tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE equipment (
  equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  manufacturer VARCHAR(255),
  maintenance_log TEXT,
  calibration_record TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE equipment (
  equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  equipment_type VARCHAR(50),
  calibration_date DATE,
  last_maintenance_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_log (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  maintenance_description TEXT,
  technician_name VARCHAR(100),
  FOREIGN KEY (equipment_id) REFERENCES equipment(equipment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE equipment (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  manufacturer VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  model VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  purchase_date DATE,
  warranty_expiry DATE,
  maintenance_notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT NOT NULL,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  maintenance_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  technician VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  comments TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_records (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE,
  calibration_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  calibration_value DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
  technician VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  comments TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  maintenance_desc TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (equipment_id) REFERENCES equipment(equipment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_records (
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  calibration_date DATE,
  calibration_result VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (equipment_id) REFERENCES equipment(equipment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_log (
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  technician VARCHAR(255),
  details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_records (
  record_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE,
  result VARCHAR(50),
  comments TEXT
);
